Description: Papyrus; On verso: Demotic text of Tale of Setne (II); recto : Greek text of land-registers from Crocodopolis, dated to Year 7 of Claudius (46-7 AD). Setne-Khaemwaset II
Dimensions: Height: 54.50 centimetres (frame (with brackets, top and bottom))
Curator's comments: Crocodilopolis is mentioned in the Greek text. Although several sites were given this name, the attestation in the text probably refers to the Panopolite nome (whose capital is Akhmim) Bibliography: G. Pinch, Magic in Ancient Egypt (London 1994), fig.23. Recent translations in: W.K. Simpson (ed.), The Literature of Ancient Egypt, New Haven & London 2003 (3rd ed.): 470-89; F. Hoffmann & J.F. Quack, Anthologie der demotischen Literatur, Berlin 2007: 118-37. To be re-studied by Sonja Fodor Greek text: Kenyon, Frederic G. / Bell, Harold Idris, Greek Papyri in the British Museum, Vol. III, London 1907. pp. 70-76 no. 604b.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (22674) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/22674)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2010-11 Oct-Mar, Leiden, National Museum Of Antiquities, Egyptian Magic 2016-2017, Oct-Jan, Arles, Musée départemental Arles antique, Khaemwaset, the archaeologist prince, knowledge and power in Ancient Egypt
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, fragmentary, insect attack, loss, spots Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
